title: Cambodia, Thailand Agree to Ceasefire After US Pressure, Ending Border Clash
snippets: Cambodia and Thailand agreed to a ceasefire on Monday, set to start at midnight local time, after attending talks in Malaysia aimed at ending a 5-day border dispute that has left dozens dead.
US President Donald Trump threatened to pause tariff negotiations until the hostilities stopped.
Malaysian PM says rival sides agree to an 'immediate and unconditional' ceasefire after five days of deadly fighting.
Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim says truce between Southeast Asian neighbours to begin at 17:00 GMT.
Following days of deadly border clashes the leaders of Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to a ceasefire.

Malaysian PM says countries have reached ‘common understanding’ to halt the worst fighting in a decade

Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to an “immediate and unconditional” ceasefire after talks in Malaysia that aimed to halt the worst fighting between the neighbouring countries in more t
Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to “an immediate and unconditional ceasefire” starting at midnight, Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said.
titles: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire. What's behind the conflict?
Thailand and Cambodia agree to 'immediate ceasefire'
Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire: Will it stop the deadly fighting?
Thailand, Cambodia agree to ‘immediate, unconditional’ ceasefire: Malaysia
Thailand and Cambodia agree to 'unconditional' ceasefire, Malaysian PM says
Thailand and Cambodia agree to ‘immediate and unconditional’ ceasefire
Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire after deadly border clashes
summary: Cambodia and Thailand have agreed to an immediate and unconditional ceasefire starting at midnight local time, following talks in Malaysia. The ceasefire aims to end a 5-day border dispute that resulted in dozens of deaths. This agreement comes after US President Donald Trump threatened to halt tariff negotiations and is considered a significant step towards peace between the Southeast Asian neighbors, marking the end of the worst fighting in a decade as stated by Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on a significant step towards peace, a solution to a problem. It provides a deeper understanding of the situation and its resolution, contributing to the reader's knowledge about international relations.

title: US Plans Response as Deaths from Malnutrition Rise in Gaza

Infant is among at least 14 people who died from malnutrition in 24 hours across Gaza, hospital source tells Al Jazeera.

titles: Gaza experiencing 'real starvation', Trump says

summary: Following Israel's Prime Minister's dismissal of hunger claims in Gaza as "lies," reports emerged of at least 14 people, including an infant, dying from malnutrition in the region within 24 hours, according to Al Jazeera. In response, the US President, after meeting with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer in Scotland, stated he is developing "various plans" to address the situation in Gaza, indicating a move towards intervention or support.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on a crisis and the attempts to solve it. It increases awareness about the situation in Gaza and the potential intervention from the US. title: PEI Confederation Bridge Toll Drops to $20; Ferry Fares Halved
snippets: Starting Aug. 1, tolls for all vehicles on the Confederation Bridge will drop from $50.25 to $20. Fares for inter-provincial ferries are also being cut by half.

Prime Minister Mark Carney says that tolls on Prince Edward Island’s Confederation Bridge will be reduced starting Aug. 1, along with a handful of other Atlantic travel fees. Starting Friday, the bridge toll for an average vehicle will drop from $50.25 to $20. The government is also cutting fa
titles: Carney cuts Confederation Bridge tolls, ferry rates to fulfill election promise
Feds cut Confederation Bridge tolls, ferry fares in Atlantic Canada
summary: Starting August 1, tolls for vehicles on Prince Edward Island's Confederation Bridge will be reduced from $50.25 to $20, as announced by Prime Minister Mark Carney. Additionally, fares for inter-provincial ferries will be cut by half, aiming to lower travel costs in the Atlantic region.
constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights a solution to high travel costs in the Atlantic region. It provides actionable information for readers who use these transportation methods and contributes to a broader understanding of regional policy changes.

title: Summer McIntosh Wins Second Gold at World Championships
snippets: Canada’s Summer McIntosh has won her second gold medal at the world swimming championships, taking the women’s 200-metre individual medley. Fellow Canadian Mary-Sophie Harvey won bronze.

Canada’s Summer McIntosh has won her second gold medal at the world swimming championships, taking the women’s 200-metre individual medley on Monday. The 18-year-old Toronto native touched the wall in two minutes, 6.69 seconds — nearly two seconds ahead of American Alex Walsh, who claimed silv
titles: Canada’s McIntosh wins second gold at world swimming championships

summary: Summer McIntosh of Canada secured her second gold medal at the world swimming championships by winning the women's 200-metre individual medley. The 18-year-old from Toronto finished with a time of 2 minutes and 6.69 seconds, outpacing second-place finisher Alex Walsh of the USA by nearly two seconds. Canadian Mary-Sophie Harvey also performed well, earning the bronze medal in the same event.
constructiveness_reason: The story reports on the achievement of Summer McIntosh, which increases awareness about her performance at the world championships. title: Scientists Probe Elusive Neutrinos to Unravel Cosmic Mysteries
snippets: Neutrinos are subatomic particles with no charge and very little mass that are known to weakly interact with other matter in the universe. Due to their weak interactions with other particles, these particles are notoriously difficult to detect.

title: New Neologisms Reflect Evolving American English
snippets: From "yeet" to "social distancing," new words and phrases constantly emerge and evolve in American English. But how do these neologisms—newly coined terms—gain acceptance and become part of mainstream dialect?
